title: FK Hajduk Bar
text:
Fudbalski klub Hajduk is a <a href="Montenegro">Montenegrin</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in the town of <a href="Bar%2C%20Montenegro">Bar</a>. They currently compete in the <a href="Montenegrin%20Third%20League">Montenegrin Third League</a> - South.
History.
FK Hajduk was founded at 2009 in <a href="Bar%2C%20Montenegro">Bar</a>, and currently is the youngest football club in that coastal town. Since establishing, FK Hajduk is playing in the <a href="Montenegrin%20Third%20League">Montenegrin Third League</a> - South.
Until now, FK Hajduk made best results in the <a href="Montenegrin%20Regional%20Cups">Southern Region Cup</a> by winning it two times. In 2016, the club were in financial trouble with club president Vasilije Milošević organising a fundraising event to keep Hajduk afloat.
Stadium.
FK Hajduk plays its important home games at <a href="Stadion%20Topolica">Stadion Topolica</a> in Bar, whose capacity is 2,500 seats. The stadium is built at the coast of <a href="Adriatic%20Sea">Adriatic Sea</a>, near the city beach and <a href="Port%20of%20Bar">Port of Bar</a>. The stadium has floodlights, and except football, it's the main athletic field in Montenegro. For other matches, FK Hajduk is using smaller stadium at Topolica Sports Complex, whose capacity is 1,000 seats.
